about.name: Monaco
about.info_text: Monaco is a tiny sovereign city-state located on the French Riviera in Western Europe. Known for its glitz, glamour, and stunning Mediterranean coastline, Monaco is a playground for the rich and famous. Despite its small size, the city-state offers a wide range of attractions, from upscale casinos and luxury boutiques to historical landmarks and beautiful gardens. Monaco's mix of natural beauty, high-end entertainment, and a rich cultural heritage makes it a unique destination on the French Riviera.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 38,000
Official Language: French
Currency: Euro (EUR)
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+1)
Climate: Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers.

attractions_card.title: Monte Carlo Casino
attractions_card.description: The Monte Carlo Casino is an iconic destination known for its opulent architecture and high-stakes gambling. It's a must-visit even for those who don't gamble, thanks to its beautiful interior and exterior.

attractions_card.title: Prince's Palace of Monaco
attractions_card.description: The Prince's Palace is the official residence of the ruling monarch of Monaco. Visitors can explore the historic palace and its stunning surroundings, including the Changing of the Guard ceremony.

attractions_card.title: Jardin Exotique de Monaco
attractions_card.description: The Jardin Exotique is a botanical garden with a vast collection of succulent plants and cacti. It offers panoramic views of Monaco and the Mediterranean Sea.

attractions_card.title: Oceanographic Museum
attractions_card.description: The Oceanographic Museum is a marine science museum founded by Prince Albert I. It houses an aquarium, maritime artifacts, and a vast collection of marine life.

attractions_card.title: Larvotto Beach
attractions_card.description: Larvotto Beach is Monaco's main public beach, offering a beautiful stretch of sand and clear blue waters. It's a great spot to relax and enjoy the Mediterranean sun.

attractions_card.title: The Rock of Monaco
attractions_card.description: The Rock of Monaco, also known as Le Rocher, is the historic heart of the city-state. It features charming narrow streets, the cathedral, and old-world architecture.

attractions_card.title: Port Hercules
attractions_card.description: Port Hercules is a bustling marina filled with luxury yachts and lined with cafes and restaurants. It's a prime spot for people-watching and enjoying the maritime atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Monaco Grand Prix Circuit
attractions_card.description: The Monaco Grand Prix is one of the most prestigious Formula 1 races, and you can walk the legendary circuit when there are no races taking place.

food_card.title: Monégasque Cuisine
food_card.description: Monaco's cuisine is influenced by French and Italian flavors. Don't miss local specialties like Barbajuan (deep-fried pastry filled with Swiss chard and ricotta) and Stocafi (dried codfish).

food_card.title: Fine Dining
food_card.description: Monaco is home to some of the world's finest restaurants, including Michelin-starred establishments. Enjoy gourmet experiences featuring French and Mediterranean cuisine.

food_card.title: French Pastries
food_card.description: Indulge in delectable French pastries and desserts at local patisseries. Try classics like croissants, macarons, and tarts.

food_card.title: Local Wines
food_card.description: Sample wines from the nearby French regions of Provence and Côte d'Azur, which pair perfectly with Mediterranean cuisine.

hotels_card.title: Hotel de Paris Monte-Carlo
hotels_card.description: Hotel de Paris is a legendary luxury hotel located near the Monte Carlo Casino, offering opulent rooms and top-notch service.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Hermitage Monte-Carlo
hotels_card.description: Hotel Hermitage is an elegant hotel with Belle Époque architecture, providing a sophisticated atmosphere and beautiful views.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont Monte Carlo
hotels_card.description: The Fairmont boasts a prime location overlooking the Mediterranean, with modern accommodations and fantastic amenities.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Metropole Monte-Carlo
hotels_card.description: Hotel Metropole offers a luxurious experience with stylish rooms, Michelin-starred dining, and a stunning pool area.

hotels_card.title: Le Meridien Beach Plaza
hotels_card.description: Le Meridien Beach Plaza is a contemporary beachfront hotel with sea-view rooms and a private beach area.

transport_card.title: Monaco Heliport
transport_card.description: The Monaco Heliport offers helicopter services to and from Nice Côte d'Azur Airport, providing a quick and scenic way to reach Monaco.

transport_card.title: Train Services
transport_card.description: The Monaco Monte Carlo Train Station connects the city-state with nearby towns and cities, making it easy to explore the French Riviera by train.

transport_card.title: Public Transportation
transport_card.description: Monaco has an efficient bus network that covers the city and surrounding areas. You can also use the city's public elevators and escalators to navigate the steep terrain.

transport_card.title: Nice Côte d'Azur Airport
transport_card.description: Nice Côte d'Azur Airport (NCE) is the closest major international airport to Monaco, with numerous flight options to destinations worldwide.
